0.title: Delhi HC asks woman to provide sanitary napkins to a school in return for quashing FIR
0.article_body: The Delhi High Court directed a woman to provide sanitary napkins to a girls' school for two months as condition for quashing FIR registered against her for extortion and criminal intimidation after the parties settled dispute amongst them. The additional public prosecutor has been directed to identify a school. The woman's case pertained to her refusing to pay an advocate.

1.title: Nobel Prize winner Svante Pääbo's father was also a Nobel winner
1.article_body: Sweden's Svante Pääbo, who won the 2022 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine on Monday, is the son of a Nobel Prize winner. His father, late Sune K Bergström, was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1982 for his discoveries concerning prostaglandins and related biologically active substances. Pääbo won the Nobel for his discoveries on human evolution.

2.title: €200-mn antitrust fine on Apple, Amazon scrapped by Italian court
2.article_body: An Italian court scrapped a fine of over €200 million imposed by the country’s antitrust authority on Apple and Amazon in 2021 for alleged collusion. The firms had been fined citing alleged anti-competitive cooperation in the sale of Apple and Beats products. The fine was reduced to €173.3 million earlier this year due to a “material error” in first calculation.

3.title: Hrithik performed wonderfully well, cannot imagine anyone else: Saif on Vedha
3.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan, who played the role of Vikram in 'Vikram Vedha', said that he never thought about playing Vedha in the film. "Hrithik (Roshan) has performed wonderfully well...You cannot imagine anyone else," he added. Saif further said it was a "very naughty" and "fascinating" character. "It's a beautifully written part...His character was definitely a mind game," Saif said.

4.title: Delhi Police register case against PFI under UAPA
4.article_body: The Delhi Police have registered a case against PFI under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA) in Southeast Delhi's Shaheen Bagh Police Station. "Reliable information has been received that certain leaders, members and associates of [PFI]...are secretly conspiring to disrupt public order," reads the FIR. Notably, three PFI offices in Delhi were sealed under UAPA's Section 8.

5.title: Pune doctors urge caution due to overlapping dengue, COVID symptoms
5.article_body: As dengue cases spike across the country, doctors have advised people to take tests to clarify the diagnosis as its symptoms overlap with COVID-19. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), since January, has reported 319 confirmed cases and nearly 3,018 suspected cases of dengue. Since the start of the pandemic, 7,08,815 COVID-19 cases and 9,746 deaths were reported within PMC limits.

6.title: AI designs battery that charges 13% faster than commercial batteries
6.article_body: Researchers have used an artificial intelligence (AI) called 'Dragonfly' to design lithium-ion batteries that charge 13% faster than commercially-available batteries. Scientists at US' Carnegie Mellon University used Dragonfly, and an automated arrangement of lab equipment called 'Clio', to run 42 experiments. Clio-Dragonfly formed six solutions that out-performed an existing electrolyte solution.

7.title: Bengaluru Police urge commuters to dial 112 to report crime on buses
7.article_body: The Bengaluru Police has urged commuters to dial 112 to report incidents of molestation and mobile thefts, among others while travelling in the city buses. The police, along with BMTC officials, pasted stickers of the Namma112 emergency helpline number inside the BMTC buses. The helpline provides help during emergency situations, including police and fire brigade services.

8.title: 'Disrespect to Prez’: Delhi L-G on Kejriwal's absence on Gandhi Jayanti
8.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena wrote a letter to CM Arvind Kejriwal, criticising him for being absent from Raj Ghat and Vijay Ghat on the birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi and Lal Bahadur Shastri. This is not only highly improper but amounts to a deliberate breach of protocol, indicative of disrespect to the Hon'ble President of India, he wrote.

9.title: LIC increases its stake in Dr Reddy's Laboratories to 7.7%
9.article_body: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Ltd (DRL) said that Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has purchased 33.86 lakh shares to increase its stake in the pharmaceutical firm to 7.7%. DRL, in its regulatory filing, said that between June 15, 2022, and September 30, 2022, LIC purchased 33,86,486 shares of DRL, aggregating a 2.034% stake from the open market.

10.title: Indian women's team registers 2nd win in a row at World Team TT C'ships
10.article_body: Indian women's table tennis team registered their second consecutive win in Group 5 at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in Chengdu, China. They defeated Egypt 3-1 on Monday. Sreeja Akula won both her matches. Diya Chitale lost her match, while Manika Batra won. India are currently second in their group standings. India lost their first tie against Germany.

11.title: Debt-ridden jeweller's decomposed body found in his shop in Thane
11.article_body: A decomposed body of a debt-ridden jeweller was found lying inside his own shop in Thane district's Mumbra. The man was missing for five days, police said, adding that it is yet to be ascertained if the man died by suicide or was murdered by someone. The deceased was identified as Bhava Jain.

12.title: AAP govt wins confidence vote called by CM Bhagwant Mann in Punjab Assembly
12.article_body: The CM Bhagwant Mann-led AAP government on Monday won the confidence motion moved by Mann in the Assembly. Mann had moved the motion on September 27 while alleging that the BJP was trying to topple his government. After the unanimous win for his government, the CM said, "Operation Lotus [has been] defeated in Punjab."

13.title: A year has passed but Lakhimpur's martyr farmers haven't got justice: Rahul
13.article_body: On the first anniversary of the Lakhimpur Kheri incident where farmers, were killed after a car ran over them, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the "martyr farmers" still haven't been given "justice". "As always the BJP is protecting the criminals...This struggle will not end without providing justice to the food providers," Rahul tweeted.

14.title: 'Be empathetic': Delhi HC urges senior lawyers to be kind to juniors
14.article_body: The Delhi HC has appealed to senior advocates to be "empathetic" and provide enough stipends to their juniors, but rejected a plea that newly enrolled lawyers be paid a minimum stipend of ₹5,000. CJ of Delhi HC Satish Chandra Sharma and Justice Subramonium Prasad said that professionals in other disciplines also faced problems similar to the ones faced by lawyers.

15.title: Vasai man moves court after son dies in e-scooter battery blast
15.article_body: A man on Monday approached a consumer court seeking compensation after his seven-year-old son was killed after the battery of an electric scooter exploded after overnight charging in Vasai. "I bought the scooter last year in August along with the battery for ₹82,000...The battery had...three-year warranty," the man said.  The boy suffered 70% burn injuries and died on September 30.

16.title: Popular YouTuber 'Dream' reveals his name and face for the first time
16.article_body: Popular YouTuber who runs the YouTube channel 'Dream', which has more than 30 million subscribers, has revealed his face to his millions of fans for the first time in a YouTube video. The YouTuber, best known for his Minecraft videos, introduced himself as Clay, without giving a last name. He won YouTube's Streamy award for gaming in 2020 and 2021.

17.title: 'Blasphemous': BJP on crew filming inside Pak gurdwara with shoes on; shares video
17.article_body: BJP has demanded prompt action in a matter, where a film crew went inside a gurdwara in Pakistan with shoes on and shot a movie without permission. BJP claims this incident has outraged the Sikh community in India. BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa shared a video of the incident and said, "Blasphemous actions continue in Pakistan".

18.title: Delhi govt launches Green War Room to monitor air pollution 24X7
18.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai has launched the first advanced Green War Room to monitor air pollution in the national capital. Rai said, "It will monitor air pollution levels 24X7 and ensure that all necessary measures are taken to curb the pollution." Notably, Green War Room is a part of the 15-point anti-pollution action plan announced by CM Arvind Kejriwal.

19.title: iPhone 14 Pro's camera housing hindering wireless charging: Reports
19.article_body: The large camera housing of Apple's iPhone 14 Pro is hindering its wireless charging capability in some cases, according to reports. Some users had complained that they experience excessive shaking in the phone's camera when using third-party apps. The shaky camera configuration could reportedly be causing problems with wireless charging.

20.title: It will create box office history all over the world: Milap on 'Adipurush'
20.article_body: Filmmaker Milap Zaveri took to Twitter and praised the teaser of 'Adipurush', saying the film "will create box office history all over the world". In another Tweet, the 'Satyameva Jayate 2' director wrote, "Kids, teenagers, adults, EVERYONE will rush to...cinemas for this film." 'Adipurush', starring Prabhas, Saif Ali Khan and Kriti Sanon, will be released in multiple languages in 2023.

21.title: BJP leader suspended for sharing selfie with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann
21.article_body: Former BJP spokesperson Kishansinh Solanki has been suspended for sharing a selfie with AAP leader and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. Solanki was suspended by BJP for "anti-party activities", hours after he posted the picture. Solanki has been suspended for a period of six years, a statement issued by Gujarat BJP said.

22.title: Punjab man gets ₹7,000 compensation after being served worm-ridden pizza
22.article_body: A consumer court has awarded a man ₹7,000 compensation after he was served a worm-ridden pizza in Punjab's Hoshiarpur. The man had reportedly found white worms inside the pizza and later developed acute pain in the stomach and loose stools. Pizza chain Captain Sam's and food delivery app Uber Eats have been directed to pay the amount within 45 days.

23.title: Hrithik performs 'Ek Pal Ka...' hook step with Falguni, video surfaces
23.article_body: Hrithik Roshan and Falguni Pathak danced together at a Navratri event on Sunday. In a video that has surfaced online, the actor could also be seen doing 'Ek Pal Ka Jeena' hook step with Falguni. Reacting to Falguni doing the hook step, a fan wrote, "She is actually dancing better than him." "New type of Garba," another fan wrote.

24.title: Foreign Minister Jaishankar is a JNU boneless wonder: Swamy
24.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy said that Union External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is a "boneless wonder" of the Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU). "He certainly cannot negotiate with hard-nosed Americans," Swamy tweeted. He added, "His (Jaishankar's) dare is a joke in [the] US. The Americans across the board ignored it. Jaishankar has thus cheapened and lowered India internationally."

25.title: 27-year-old man passes away after experiencing chest pain while playing garba in Mumbai
25.article_body: A 27-year-old man identified as Rishabh passed away after experiencing chest pain while playing garba in Mumbai. The man fell down after experiencing chest pain and was admitted to a nearby hospital, where he was pronounced dead. He was a resident of Dombivili West and worked at a private company.

26.title: No competition with Nagarjuna: Chiranjeevi on Godfather-The Ghost clash
26.article_body: Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' and Nagarjuna's 'The Ghost' will release on October 5. Reacting to the clash, Chiranjeevi has said, "There's no competition with Nagarjuna." "Both the films are unique and we're trying to showcase our talent in it and prove ourselves," Chiranjeevi added. Last week, Nagarjuna had said both films should hopefully be a hit at the box office.

27.title: Indian men's team wins 3rd straight match at World Team TT Championships
27.article_body: Indian men's team beat Kazakhstan 3-2 to register their third straight win in Group 2 at ITTF World Team Championships Finals 2022 in Chengdu, China, on Monday. India were 2-1 ahead, before Sathiyan Gnanasekaran lost his second match. Harmeet Desai won the last match to help the team win the tie. India are currently on top of their group standings.

28.title: 2 teenage sisters go missing in UP; uniform, bicycle found on roadside
28.article_body: Two teenage sisters, aged 13 and 14, went missing from UP's Barabanki after leaving home for school, police said on Monday. Their clothes and cycles were found on the roadside, following which police launched a search. The girls left home at 8:00 am and their belongings were found at about 8:45 am, after which the villagers informed the police.

29.title: Pune ACB arrests police officer for demanding bribe of ₹1 lakh
29.article_body: The Pune unit of the Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) arrested a police sub-inspector for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹1 lakh from an accused in a criminal case. The ACB received a complaint against the sub-inspector and an advocate through whom he demanded the bribe from an accused in a criminal case. The advocate was also booked.

30.title: Family behind cooler maker Symphony buys ₹72.85 crore apartment in Mumbai
30.article_body: The family of air cooler-making company Symphony Limited's Founder, Achal Bakeri, has bought a luxury apartment in Mumbai for ₹72.85 crore, Moneycontrol reported. Achal Bakeri Family Trust and Achal Anil Bakeri, represented by Rupa Achal Bakeri, bought the apartment, the documents showed. Spread across 7,762 sq ft, the property is located in Oberoi Three Sixty West, Worli.

31.title: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' earns ₹17 lakh from single screening in the US
31.article_body: SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' collected around $21,000 (approximately ₹17,17,000) after a single show in the Chinese Theatre in Los Angeles. As per Deadline, the 932-seat theatre was sold out within 20 minutes. Rajamouli also received a standing ovation after the film's screening. 'RRR', which had released in March, has already earned over ₹1,000 crore worldwide.

32.title: Mumbai Police arrests 4 for cheating businessman posing as CBI officers
32.article_body: Goregaon Police arrested four people for cheating a Mumbai-based businessman by posing as CBI officers. One of the accused had promised the man a ₹1.6 crore loan if the victim provided him with a ₹5 lakh commission. The accused then claimed to be CBI officers and ‘questioned’ the victim, ultimately demanding that he pay the ₹5 lakh as a bribe.

33.title: Mumbai Customs seizes 9.1 kg gold worth ₹4.53 crore over two days
33.article_body: Customs at Mumbai's International Airport seized a total of 9.1 kg of smuggled gold worth ₹4.53 crore in six cases over two days. The largest haul came from an Indian passenger from Dubai who was carrying 4.5 kg of gold dust valued at ₹2.14 crore. Officials also caught 1.4 kg of 24-carat gold bars worth ₹72.79 lakh from a flight.

34.title: U-20 world champion wrestler Antim Panghal wins gold on National Games debut
34.article_body: Under-20 world champion wrestler Antim Panghal won the gold medal in the women's 53-kg final at 36th National Games in Gujarat on Sunday. Haryana's Antim beat Priyanshi Prajapati of Madhya Pradesh by fall in the final of her maiden National Games. Antim became the first-ever Indian woman to win gold at the Under-20 Wrestling World Championships in August.

35.title: Optus confirms personal info of 1.2 mn users leaked in cyberattack
35.article_body: Optus on Monday confirmed that personal information and at least one valid form of identification of about 1.2 million users was compromised due to a cyberattack late last month. The cyberattack also affected expired IDs and personal information of about 900,000 customers, Optus added.  "The exposed information didn't contain valid...document ID numbers for some 7.7 million customers," it said.

36.title: Never let gender come in the way of ambitions: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
36.article_body: While addressing an event organised by NGO Yuva Unstoppable, Biocon Founder Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw said gender must not come in the way of ambitions. "My parents always told me that just because I'm a girl doesn't mean I cannot dream big," she said. Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, who won Padma Bhushan in 2005, has a net worth of $2.8 billion, according to Forbes.

37.title: US and Philippines begin 2-week joint naval exercises
37.article_body: The armed forces of the US and Philippines launched joint naval drills on Monday. The "Cooperation of the warriors of the sea" or "KAMANDAG" is a two-week exercise which involves 2,550 American and 530 Filipino troops. Japan and South Korea will join the drills as observers. The US and Philippines are a part of a 70-year-old Mutual Defence Treaty.

38.title: 'No vandalism' says Canada Police after India condemned hate crime at Bhagavad Gita park
38.article_body: After India condemned the hate crime at Shri Bhagavad Gita Park in Brampton in Canada, Peel Regional Police tweeted, "There was no evidence of vandalism." Meanwhile, Brampton Mayor Patrick Brown said, "We learned that the reported blank sign was installed by the builder as a placeholder until the permanent Shri Bhagavad Gita Park sign can be replaced tomorrow."

39.title: He's not him-first but team-first type of captain: Sammy on Rohit
39.article_body: Praising India captain Rohit Sharma, West Indies' two-time T20 World Cup-winning captain Daren Sammy said, "He's not a 'him-first' but a 'team-first' type of captain." He added, "I love the way he captains. That's why Mumbai Indians have been one of the most successful IPL franchises." Rohit-led India won the recently concluded three-match T20I series against Australia 2-1.

40.title: Uddhav Thackeray-led party is real Shiv Sena: NCP leader
40.article_body: NCP leader Mahesh Tapase said Uddhav Thackeray-led party is the "real" Shiv Sena. "Even though the decision on which is the real Shiv Sena is pending with the Election Commission, the real Shiv Sena is the one that has the ideas of Balasaheb (Thackeray) which means it is the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena," Tapase added.

41.title: 1 dead, 64 injured after passenger bus overturns in J&K's Udhampur
41.article_body: One person was killed and 64 others, including students, were injured after a bus met with an accident in Udhampur. The police informed that the bus was coming from Moungri, Khor Gali. According to reports, the driver had lost control of the bus, which led to the accident. The injured have been shifted to Udhampur district hospital for treatment.

42.title: India Women beat Malaysia to register their 2nd straight win in Asia Cup
42.article_body: India Women defeated Malaysia by 30 runs (DLS method) to register their second straight win in the ongoing Asia Cup. India Women posted 181/ 4 in 20 overs and reduced Malaysia to 16/2 before rain halted the match. Sabbhineni Meghana top-scored for India with 69 runs off 53 balls while Shafali Verma scored 46 runs off 39 balls.

43.title: Credit Suisse shares hit record low, market value down by 60% this year
43.article_body: Shares of Credit Suisse touched a new record low after declining 12% on Monday to 3.52 Swiss francs ($3.7). The bank has lost about 60% of its market value this year and is on the track for the biggest annual drop in its history. Recently, CEO Ulrich Korner told his staff that the bank is at a "critical moment".

44.title: Big B, Rashmika's 'Goodbye' tickets to be sold at ₹150 on release day
44.article_body: The tickets for the upcoming film 'Goodbye', starring Amitabh Bachchan and Rashmika Mandanna, will be sold at ₹150 on its release day, the makers said on Monday. The film is set to release on October 7. The Vikas Bahl directorial marks Rashmika's Bollywood debut. The family drama also stars Neena Gupta and Pavail Gulati, among others.

45.title: Money is the prime reason for taking up 'Bigg Boss 16': Manya Singh
45.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Manya Singh said money was the "prime reason" for her to take part in the show. She added she also wanted to be recognised. Manya revealed she withdrew from Miss India training to become an actress. "Since...people have liked me in real life, I'm not scared to be under...spotlight 24X7 on the show," she added.

46.title: 200 railway stations across country to be revamped: Railway Minister
46.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw on Monday said 200 railway stations across the country will get a facelift with modern amenities. "Overhead spaces will be created on the stations which will have world-class facilities including waiting lounges and food courts, besides amusement facilities for children," he added. "Government has prepared a master plan to revamp 200 railway stations," he stated.

47.title: Cong on bail, 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is sinister campaign: K'taka CM
47.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said Congress is a party on bail and called its 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' a "sinister campaign". "Rahul Gandhi, his mother and Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi and KPCC President all are on bail," he said, adding that all the cases against the party are related to corruption.

48.title: US startup Wisk Aero unveils self-flying electric four-seater air taxi, shares pics
48.article_body: California-based startup Wisk Aero has unveiled its sixth-generation aircraft, an electric air taxi that can accommodate four passengers and fly without a human pilot. It has a cruising speed of 120 knots, a range of 140 kilometres with reserves, and can fly at an altitude of 2,500-4,000 feet above ground. Wisk has sought regulatory approval for commercial air taxi service.

49.title: Delhi reports over 400 Dengue cases last week, total crosses 900
49.article_body: Delhi has reported a rise in dengue cases as 412 people were diagnosed with the infection in the last week alone, official data showed. Delhi has reported 693 dengue cases in the month of September, taking the national capital's total tally to 937 so far this year. However, no dengue-related deaths have been reported in Delhi this year till now.

50.title: Top seeds Bopanna-Middelkoop win men's doubles title in Tel Aviv
50.article_body: Top seeds Rohan Bopanna and Matwe Middelkoop won Tel Aviv Watergen Open men's doubles title after beating third seeds Santiago Gonzalez and Andres Molteni 6-2, 6-4 in final. The Indo-Dutch pair won the title on Sunday. It was third title of 2022 for 42-year-old Bopanna. He won the first two at the start of the year partnering compatriot Ramkumar Ramanathan.

51.title: Vijay Sethupathi to star in a silent film titled 'Gandhi Talks'
51.article_body: Tamil actor Vijay Sethupathi will star in a silent film titled 'Gandhi Talks', which will be helmed by Kishor P Belekar. The AR Rahman musical will also star Arvind Swami and Aditi Rao Hydari. Talking about the film, the director said, "Conveying emotions by switching off the device of dialogue is not only scary but also interesting and challenging."

52.title: So happy to see Rajat Patidar, Mukesh Kumar in squad for SA ODIs: Karthik
52.article_body: Reacting to batter Rajat Patidar receiving his maiden Team India call-up for the three-match ODI series against South Africa, India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "So happy to see Rajat there...deserves this selection." He added, "Well done to Mukesh Kumar too...now, Sarfaraz Khan and Baba Indrajith into the test scheme of things." The ODI series will begin on October 6.

53.title: Blockchain startup XDC Network raises $50 million from LDA Capital
53.article_body: Blockchain startup XDC Network has secured $50 million in funding from LDA Capital. XDC Network was co-founded by Atul Khekade and Ritesh Kakkad. Khekade and Kakkad also co-founded TradeFinex in 2017. XDC Network offers services like Metaverses, NFT marketplaces, oracles, decentralised email providers and cloud storage.

54.title: Chhattisgarh CM takes part in Garba Raas at his house, shares pics
54.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Sunday took part in a Garba Raas programme along with his family members, which was organised at his residence in Raipur on the occasion of Navratri. He also shared pictures of the programme in which he can be seen playing dandiya. The event was held on behalf of Samagra Gujarati Samaj, Baghel tweeted.

55.title: Hacker siphons off $23 mn from Transit Swap, later returns 70% of loot
55.article_body: A hacker on Saturday exploited decentralised exchange platform Transit Swap's internal bug and siphoned off $23 million. However, after Transit Swap and security companies reportedly began ascertaining vital information related to the cyberattack, the hacker returned 70% of the loot, or roughly $16.2 million, within 24 hours. "We'll continue to work hard to recover more assets," Transit Swap said.

56.title: S Jaishankar to visit New Zealand & Australia from October 5 to 11
56.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will visit Australia and New Zealand from October 5-11 to strengthen India's relations with both the countries in key areas ranging from trade to security. This will be Jaishankar's first visit to New Zealand. Jaishankar will participate in an event on October 6 along with the PM of New Zealand, Jacinda Ardern.

57.title: Europe faces unprecedented risk of shortage of natural gas: IEA
57.article_body: Europe faces "unprecedented risks" to natural gas supplies this winter, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said in its quarterly gas report. It said EU countries will need to reduce usage by 13% over the winter in case of a complete cutoff by Russia. On Friday, the EU agreed to mandate reduction in electricity consumption by 5% during peak price hours.

58.title: Saif, Hrithik's 'Vikram Vedha' collects ₹38 crore on opening weekend
58.article_body: Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan-starrer 'Vikram Vedha' has earned around ₹38 crore at the domestic box office within three days of its release. The film, directed by Pushkar and Gayatri, is a remake of the filmmaker duo's 2017 Tamil film of the same name. The remake also stars Radhika Apte, Yogita Bihani, Rohit Saraf, Sharib Hashmi and others.

59.title: Had long gap after filming, it didn't fit anymore: Remo on Kesariya dance mix
59.article_body: While talking about 'Kesariya' dance mix, choreographer Remo D'Souza said that 50 dancers from Mumbai and local artistes were part of the song. "There was...long gap [after the filming], and when he [Ayan Mukerji] saw the movie, a dance sequence didn't fit in the storyline...So, he made it the journey song that we finally see in the film," he added.

60.title: Congress workers wish to take on BJP rather than each other: Tharoor
60.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said everybody in the party wish to take on BJP rather than each other. "I agree with Kharge ji that all of us in Congress wish to take on BJP...There's no ideological difference between us," Tharoor said. "The choice for our voting colleagues on October 17 is only on how to do it most effectively," he stated.

61.title: JSW Cement raises ₹400 crore as sustainability-linked loan from MUFG Bank
61.article_body: JSW Cement said it has raised ₹400 crore from MUFG Bank India as its first sustainability-linked loan. The company said it plans to use it to achieve its annual capacity target of 25 million tonne (MT) by FY25. Parth Jindal, Managing Director of JSW Cement, said the funds would also be used towards its environmental, social, and governance (ESG) objectives.

62.title: PM Modi foiled divisive forces' attempts to divide the country: Bommai
62.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai claimed that PM Modi foiled attempts by divisive forces, who were trying to divide the country on the basis of language and rationality. "The countrymen are watching some political parties which are indirectly and some directly supporting anti-national elements," Bommai said. He also added that those playing politics with the nation's security will not be spared.

63.title: Apple responds to why junkyard crash tests don't always trigger iPhones' Crash Detection
63.article_body: Responding to why junkyard crash tests don't always trigger iPhones' Crash Detection feature, Apple said it depends on testing conditions in the junkyard. It stated that in one of the tests, the junkyard didn't provide enough signals to the iPhone to trigger the feature in the stopped cars. The feature works mostly only in devices that are in moving vehicles.

64.title: UP Police arrests PFI activist involved in anti-national activities
64.article_body: The UP Police have arrested a Popular Front of India (PFI) activist in Ayodhya, involved in anti-national activities. The police have accused him of provoking Muslims against Hindus and targeting members of the Hindu community through terror activities. The accused has been identified as Mohd Zaid and is said to be an active member of Tablighi Jamaat of Nizamuddin Markaz.

65.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh takes sortie in 'Prachand' helicopter, video surfaces
65.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday took a sortie in a 'Prachand' helicopter after the first batch of made-in-India light combat helicopters was inducted into the IAF in Jodhpur. "It was a smooth and comfortable flight. It can fly in any terrain, weather, and altitude," the minister said. He added, "Our motto is: make in India, make for the world."

66.title: 'Disappointing Adipurush' trends on Twitter, people call its VFX 'poor'
66.article_body: 'Disappointing Adipurush' has begun trending on Twitter as several users called the VFX of Prabhas-starrer poor. This comes a day after the teaser of 'Adipurush' was released. A Twitter user wrote, "Even the [actor and actress] don't look real in 'Adipurush' teaser." Another user wrote, "Looks like Raavan time travelled and had a haircut in the 2020s."

67.title: Will only be left with 'hum doh hamare doh': BJP leader on Uddhav
67.article_body: BJP's Maharashtra unit president Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Monday said Shiv Sena leader Uddhav Thackeray should stop taking jibes at others or else the few party members standing by him will also leave. "He will only have 'hum doh hamare doh' and there will be no one else with him," the BJP leader said.

68.title: CNG price hiked by ₹4 per kg in Pune, to now cost ₹91 per kg
68.article_body: Maharashtra Natural Gas Ltd has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) by ₹4 per kg in Pune, Pimpri-Chinchwad and adjoining areas of Chakan, Talegaon and Hinjewadi. CNG will now cost ₹91 per kg in these areas. Further, the price of Domestic Piped Natural Gas has also been increased by ₹3 and it would now cost ₹52.50 per SCM.

69.title: Apple testing under-display Touch ID but may not implement it: Report
69.article_body: Apple won't release its new iPhones with Touch ID despite testing the feature, said a report. The report said Apple tested in-screen Touch ID for the iPhone and has also considered adding Touch ID to the power button, similar to the iPad Air and iPad mini. Apple introduced the Touch ID fingerprint biometric sensor on the iPhone 5s in 2013.

70.title: Randeep Hooda begins shooting for 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'
70.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda took to Instagram to announce that he has begun shooting for his upcoming film 'Swatantra Veer Savarkar'. Randeep will make his directorial debut with the film after filmmaker-actor Mahesh Manjrekar stepped down as the film's director. Randeep shared a picture holding the film's clapboard and wrote, "This is a special moment."

71.title: Bhogle asks Rohit Sharma 'How do you protect Suryakumar's form?', his reply goes viral
71.article_body: Following Suryakumar Yadav's 61(22) against South Africa, commentator Harsha Bhogle asked India captain Rohit Sharma, "How do you protect Suryakumar's form?" Rohit responded, "Just thinking not to play him anymore. Just play him on October 23 (against Pakistan)...He's somebody who wants to play...who wants to keep going out there...That's what keeps him happy and we want to keep him happy."

72.title: There's no other option, India have got to stick with current bowlers: Jaffer
72.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said death bowling is a concern for India going into the T20 WC, but there's no other option but to back the current pacers. "So close to the tournament, you don't want to chop and change," he stated. Arshdeep Singh conceded 62 runs in the second South Africa T20I, while Harshal Patel conceded 45.

73.title: Unaccounted cash, gold biscuits worth ₹1.71 cr seized from passenger in Thane
73.article_body: Unaccounted cash and two gold biscuits worth ₹1.71 crore were found in the backpack of a passenger at the Titwala railway station in Thane, an RPF official said on Monday. The accused couldn't give a satisfactory response when questioned about the source of the money and gold, the official said. The accused said that he was coming from Lucknow.

74.title: Class 9 student's eardrum ruptured as teacher slaps him in Mumbai
74.article_body: A 14-year-old Class 9 student's eardrum ruptured after a teacher allegedly slapped him during a class in Mumbai's school. The Sanskrit teacher allegedly slapped the boy on suspicion of making noises. Meanwhile, the boy's mother filed a complaint against the teacher and said that doctor's report stated that her son suffered a hole in his eardrum due to the incident.

75.title: Want to learn & teach myself what my kind of films are: Rashmika
75.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said she wants to "learn and teach" herself what her kind of films are because she hasn't figured that out yet. "This is the time for me to spread my wings and do every kind of film," she said, adding she doesn't want to get comfortable in a particular kind of genre. Rashmika's upcoming film is 'Goodbye'.

76.title: Report auto drivers asking high fares for short rides: B'luru police
76.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police (BTP) on Sunday asked the city's residents to report auto drivers charging high fares for short rides. "You can call our automated IVRS to book complaints. Please call 080-22868550 / 22868444," BTP tweeted. Karnataka government had raised auto fares in November, fixing a ₹30-charge for the first two kilometres and ₹15 for every kilometre after that.

77.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook reveals 4 qualities he looks for while hiring people
77.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook, while speaking at the University of Naples Federico II's commencement ceremony, revealed the four qualities he looks for when he's hiring people. "We look for collaboration...we believe small teams can do incredible things," Cook said. "We look for creativity, for people who think different...we look for curiosity, and of course, we look for expertise," Cook added.

78.title: CIA official helped Moosewala murder accused Tinu escape police custody: FIR
78.article_body: The CIA in-charge of Mansa Police, sub-inspector Pritpal Singh, was a part of the conspiracy to help Deepak Tinu, accused in the murder of singer Sidhu Moosewala, escape from police custody, an FIR said. "The CIA in-charge took him alone in his private vehicle. He did not take any other security personnel with him," the FIR said.

79.title: Path of truth is not easy: Kejriwal to Satyendar Jain on his birthday
79.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday wished AAP minister Satyendar Jain on his birthday, saying that path of truth is not easy. "He's been in jail for four months due to a fake case," Kejriwal tweeted. "He gave mohalla clinics...arranged for free and good treatment for everyone. These people want to stop welfare work for the public," he added.

80.title: Stop the spiral of violence and death in Ukraine: Pope Francis to Putin
80.article_body: Pope Francis "begged" Russian President Vladimir Putin to stop the "spiral of violence and death" in Ukraine, adding that the crisis was risking a nuclear escalation with catastrophic global consequences. He condemned Russia's annexation of Ukrainian territories as being against international law. "I address...President of Ukraine to be open to a serious peace proposal," he added.

81.title: Nobel Prize in Medicine awarded to Svante Pääbo for his discoveries on human evolution
81.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine has been awarded to Sweden's Svante Pääbo "for his discoveries concerning the genomes of extinct hominins and human evolution". Pääbo made the discovery of an extinct hominin, the Denisova, and found that gene transfer had occurred from extinct hominins to Homo sapiens. The Nobel Assembly said that Pääbo's discovery has physiological relevance.

82.title: He's a wonderful actor, I'm pleased: Rahul on Kartik being cast in Aashiqui 3
82.article_body: Actor Rahul Roy, who made his debut with 'Aashiqui', spoke about Kartik Aaryan being cast in the third instalment of the franchise. He called Kartik a "wonderful young actor" and said that he's pleased with the casting."He has a history of picking...right films...The box-office figures are also working in Kartik's favour, so I wish him all the best," Rahul stated.

83.title: Many teams will fear playing us at T20 WC: Moeen after Eng's T20Is win vs Pak
83.article_body: Following England's 4-3 win in T20I series against Pakistan, England stand-in skipper Moeen Ali said his side is a very dangerous team to play and a lot of teams will fear playing them at upcoming T20 World Cup. "We're in a very good position now going into...World Cup," he added. England beat Pakistan by 67 runs in seventh T20I.

84.title: 2 B'luru employees found doing subpar work booked for rigging interviews
84.article_body: Siemens Healthcare, located in Bengaluru's Electronic City, has filed a case against two newly-recruited software developers and another person for allegedly rigging the interview process. The case came to light after the developers' seniors noticed they were doing subpar work. The third person, a hiring executive, was paid for telling the developers the technical questions before the interview.

85.title: If Bumrah is not available, then Mohammed Siraj: Shane Watson
85.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said pacer Mohammed Siraj should replace Jasprit Bumrah in India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup if the latter is ruled out of the tournament. "Without Bumrah, [firepower] is the one thing India won't necessarily have...Siraj is great with the brand new ball. He is fast, he swings the ball away," added Watson.

86.title: Ex-UP CM & SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav admitted to CCU at Gurugram hospital
86.article_body: Former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav has been admitted to the Critical Care Unit (CCU) at Medanta Hospital in Gurugram. Yadav is being treated by a comprehensive team of specialists, the hospital said. The 82-year-old has been undergoing treatment for the last few weeks.

87.title: Hearing great reviews, not surprised: 'Ponniyin...' actor Jayam on 'Vikram...'
87.article_body: 'Ponniyin Selvan' actor Jayam Ravi took to Twitter and praised Hrithik Roshan and Saif Ali Khan-starrer 'Vikram Vedha'. He wrote, "Hearing great reviews about #VikramVedha...and I'm not surprised as...Tamil version was a knockout," he wrote, tagging Pushkar and Gayatri, the filmmaker duo who helmed the original film and its remake. "A big congrats to Hrithik & Saif for...success," Jayam added.

88.title: Ananya is very smart, she knows how to handle herself: Bhavana Pandey
88.article_body: Speaking about actress Ananya Panday's professional and personal choices, her mother Bhavana Pandey has said that Ananya is a smart and intelligent girl, who knows how to handle herself. "When Ananya joined the industry, she was 18 or 19 years old...that's the age when maximum learning happens," she added. Bhavana stated Ananya "literally" grew up in front of the camera.

89.title: Nykaa board announces 5:1 bonus shares issue, stock surges 11%
89.article_body: The board of FSN E-Commerce Ventures, Nykaa's parent company, has announced five bonus shares for each share a shareholder holds, the company informed the stock exchanges. Shares of FSN E-Commerce Ventures surged 11% to the day's high price of ₹1,414 on Monday after the 5:1 bonus share issue announcement. Bonus shares are fully paid additional shares issued to existing shareholders.

90.title: Man who threatened Maha CM Shinde arrested, full attention on his security: Fadnavis
90.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said that the person who threatened state Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has been arrested. Fadnavis further said that full attention is being paid to the security of the Chief Minister. The accused had called up the police control room claiming a "plot" to kill Chief Minister Shinde at a hotel in Lonavala.

91.title: No bigger dream than this: Karan on working with Sunny Deol in 'Apne 2'
91.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol and his son Karan Deol will share screen space in 'Apne 2'. Talking about working with his father, Karan said, "No bigger dream than this where I am getting not only to work with him but also to share the screen space with him." Karan made his debut with the 2019 film 'Pal Pal Dil Ke Paas'.

92.title: EV finance firm Mufin Green raises $5.7 million in funding
92.article_body: Electric vehicle financing company Mufin Green Finance has secured $5.7 million in a Series A funding round led by Incofin India Progress Fund. In August this year, Mufin Group renamed its subsidiary APM Finvest to Mufin Green Finance Limited. The newly-listed non-banking finance company claims to have financed electric vehicles worth more than $19 million (₹160 crore) across nine states.

93.title: Bypolls to 7 Assembly seats across 6 states to be held on November 3
93.article_body: By-elections to seven Assembly seats across six states will be held on November 3. The elections will be held in Maharashtra, Bihar, Odisha, Haryana, Telangana and Uttar Pradesh. The results will be announced on November 6. A schedule shared by the Election Commission of India also mentioned that the last date for withdrawal of candidatures will be October 17.

94.title: Urmila Matondkar to make OTT debut with web series 'Tiwari'
94.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar is making her OTT debut with a thriller web series, titled 'Tiwari'. "This one offered me characters and a story arc that is challenging as a performer and things that I haven't attempted so far," she said. She added that the series is an emotional mother-daughter story at its core, with "some thrilling twists and turns".

95.title: No intention of contesting polls, will make good films on politics: Kangana
95.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she has no intentions of contesting the elections. "I look forward to serving those who are doing good for the country...Will do all kinds of propaganda for those who are serving the country...I am interested in politics as an artist. Will make good films on politics," she added.

96.title: CPWD invites pre-qualified bids for ₹360 crore PM’s residential complex
96.article_body: The Central Public Works Department (CPWD) has invited pre-qualification bids for the ₹360 crore Prime Minister's residential complex. Reports said that the complex will be completed within 21 months from the date of award of the tender. It will be ground plus one storey and will include a guest house, Special Protection Group office, support staff quarters and CPWD office.

97.title: Farhan Akhtar, you front organisation called MARD: Sona on Sajid Khan
97.article_body: Speaking about Sajid Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16' participation, Sona Mohapatra tweeted, "Dear Farhan Akhtar, you front an organisation called 'MARD'...Speak up...only when it's convenient or pays to virtue signal for 'our cause' not now?" In another tweet, Sona called TV channels and executives "depraved and sad lot". Sajid was accused of sexual misconduct by many women during the #MeToo movement.

98.title: Apple acknowledges microphone issue in Watch Series 8 and Ultra
98.article_body: Apple has acknowledged that some Watch Series 8 and Ultra users may experience microphone issues, MacRumors reported citing a memo. It said the users may face trouble when trying to use Siri or making a phone call, among other things. Apple said restarting the device may temporarily fix the problem and suggested the problem is not hardware related.

99.title: Pastor kills neighbour's pet dog with air gun in Andhra; booked
99.article_body: A 65-year-old pastor was booked for allegedly shooting his neighbour's pet dog with an air gun and killing it under Nandigama police station limits in Andhra Pradesh. The incident took place when the dog started barking after entering the pastor's home, a police officer said. "[The pastor] had warned...neighbours against this several times in the past," the police officer added.

100.title: Delhi govt initiates trial run of 26 new bus routes in city
100.article_body: The Delhi government initiated the trial run of 26 new bus routes in the city. The routes were drawn up under a route rationalisation plan to provide better connectivity to major crowd centres, including poorly served areas, officials said. A four-member committee was formed to oversee the rationalisation plan to make sure that bus routes are evenly spread across Delhi.

101.title: Adam Gilchrist names his 5 players for dream World T20I XI
101.article_body: Former Australia wicketkeeper-batter Adam Gilchrist has named the first five players he would pick in a dream World T20I XI. He included Australia opener David Warner, Pakistan captain Babar Azam, India all-rounder Hardik Pandya, Afghanistan all-rounder Rashid Khan and England white-ball captain Jos Buttler. "He is just an awesome figure straight across the board," Gilchrist said about Pandya.

102.title: Will show unknown facets of her life: Madhubala’s sister on actress' biopic
102.article_body: Madhubala's sister Madhur Brij Bhushan said the late actress' biopic "will showcase several unknown facets" of her life. She said the film will put several inaccuracies about her life to rest. Madhur added that she won't let anyone else make any project based on or inspired by Madhubala's life and called the biopic her "family's emotional and legal right".

103.title: China's Geely buys 7.6% stake in Aston Martin
103.article_body: China-based Zhejiang Geely announced on Friday that it has bought a 7.6% stake in British luxury carmaker Aston Martin. However, the financial details of the deal were not disclosed. Geely's stake is valued at about $74 million, based on Thursday's closing share price. Aston Martin also separately announced the completion of a $732 million capital raise.

104.title: 35-yr-old man dies while dancing, his 66-yr-old father dies of shock in Maha
104.article_body: A 35-year-old man collapsed and died while dancing at a garba event in Maharashtra's Virar, the police said on Monday. The man was rushed to the hospital by his 66-year-old father and was declared dead on arrival. On hearing about his son's death, the father also collapsed and died on the spot, the police said.

105.title: What a disgrace: Infosys ex-CFO Pai on B'luru in bottom 3 in cleanliness rankings
105.article_body: Infosys' former CFO Mohandas Pai took to Twitter to share his disappointment after Bengaluru was ranked 43rd among 45 cities in the government's latest Swachh Survekshan rankings. "What a disgrace! India's only global city, the richest city has become a garbage city! We are ashamed," he tweeted. Demanding "urgent reforms", Pai tagged Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai in his tweet.

106.title: Met Gala 2023 to celebrate work of late designer Karl Lagerfeld
106.article_body: Met Gala 2023 will celebrate the work of the late German-born couturier Karl Lagerfeld, who passed away in 2019. The Met Gala theme is borrowed from the accompanying exhibit at the Met's Costume Institute, titled 'Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty'. The exhibition will gather around 150 of Karl's creations to explore his "stylistic language".

107.title: I'm scared, Pakistan might crash out in 1st round of 2022 T20 WC: Akhtar
107.article_body: Criticising the Babar Azam-led Pakistan, ex-pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said their middle-order is "not good" going into the 2022 T20 World Cup. "With this team, we might get knocked out in the first round itself. I'm really scared as our batting has no depth. Our captain is also not cut out for this format...He wants to look classic," stated Shoaib.

108.title: Businessman, actor, filmmaker Atlas Ramachandran passes away at 80 in Dubai
108.article_body: Kerala-born businessman MM Ramachandran, popularly known as Atlas Ramachandran, passed away at the age of 80 in Dubai on Sunday night after a cardiac arrest, according to reports. He was the founder of now-defunct Atlas Jewellery and produced several Malayalam films. He had also acted in several films.

109.title: Half of mobilised men in Russian region sent home, commissar fired
109.article_body: The military commissar of Russia's Khabarovsk, Yuri Laiko, was removed after half of the newly mobilised personnel were sent home as they failed to meet the draft criteria, region's Governor Mikhail Degtyaryov said. "Removal of the commissar would not affect the mobilisation plan," he added. Officials and citizens have complained that enlistment officers sent call-up papers to ineligible men.

110.title: Kareena gets scared as man keeps hand on her shoulder for selfies; video surfaces
110.article_body: A video showing actress Kareena Kapoor Khan getting scared and uncomfortable after a man kept his hand on her shoulder for selfies at Mumbai airport is being widely circulated on social media. Kareena's security staff could be seen pushing the man away. The actress was surrounded by a group of fans who were trying to click pictures with her.

111.title: PM Modi to inaugurate UN Geospatial Information Congress in Hyd
111.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate UN Geospatial Information Congress in Hyderabad on October 11. The conference's theme is "Geo-Enabling the Global Village: No one should be left behind". PM Modi-led government is "playing an enabler's role in expanding...scope of geospatial applications in multiple spheres to benefit every section of the society in India," Union Minister Jitendra Singh said.

112.title: Celsius' ex-CEO withdrew $10 million before firm froze customer accounts: Report
112.article_body: Founder and former CEO of Celsius Network Alex Mashinsky allegedly withdrew $10 million from the cryptocurrency platform weeks before it froze customer funds and filed bankruptcy, as per a report. He reportedly withdrew the funds in "mid to late May" while the platform paused customer withdrawals in June. Celsius in July filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy citing "extreme market conditions".

113.title: Pune secures 9th rank among 45 cities in Swachh Survekshan
113.article_body: Pune city’s ranking has dropped to ninth from last year's fifth in terms of cleanliness in the Centre's annual Swachh Survekshan. Indore was adjudged the country's cleanest city for the sixth time in a row. The Swachh Survekshan competition is organised every year by the central government among 45 cities with a population of more than 10 lakh people.

114.title: There’s no G-23 group, it was all media’s idea: Cong’s Shashi Tharoor
114.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Monday said, "There’s no G-23 group, it was all the media’s idea." Furthermore, he said, "A couple of senior leaders wrote a letter, they invited a large number of people to support them…COVID-19 lockdown was on in 2020 and at that time only 23 leaders were available in Delhi to sign the letter."

115.title: Auto driver gets into a head-on collision with SUV in Chandigarh, killed
115.article_body: An auto driver was killed in a head-on collision with a car in front of the Sector 34 parade ground in Chandigarh on Saturday. Reports said he was driving in front of the exhibition ground when he collided with a white Ford EcoSport SUV. He was rushed to Government Medical College and Hospital in sector 32 but died during treatment.

116.title: Pak is not as dominant, it's Indo-Pac with 'C', not Indo-Pak with 'K': British envoy
116.article_body: British High Commissioner to India, Alex Ellis, has said that Pakistan is not as dominant as it once was, adding, "Our focus has shifted towards India." He said, "I keep saying, it is Indo-Pac with a 'C' rather than Indo-Pak with a 'K'." The UK's relationship has changed with Pakistan a lot as it withdrew from Afghanistan, he added.

117.title: We've competed well & we can walk away with our heads held high: Miller
117.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller has said it's "very disappointing" to lose the T20I series against India, but they've competed well in recent games and they can "at least walk away with their heads held high". "I don't think it's too much to worry about," he added. Chasing India's 238-run target, Miller smashed 106*(47) to help SA get to 221/3.

118.title: Sonia Gandhi to participate in Bharat Jodo Yatra on October 6: Reports
118.article_body: According to reports, Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi will participate in the Bharat Jodo Yatra on October 6 in Karnataka. This will be Sonia Gandhi's first participation in the yatra, which began while she was abroad for a medical check-up. The yatra will pass through Karnataka for 21 days, covering 511 km in the state.

119.title: Poverty in country standing like 'demon' in front of us: RSS' Hosabale
119.article_body: RSS General Secretary Dattatreya Hosabale on Sunday said that poverty in the country is standing like a "demon" in front of us. "It's important that we slay this demon. That 20 crore people are still below...poverty line is a figure that should make us very sad...As many as 23 crore people have less than ₹375 income per day," Hosabale added.

120.title: 11-year-old boy kidnapped from Gr Noida, rescued within 24 hours
120.article_body: An 11-year-old boy who was kidnapped from Greater Noida has been rescued by the police within 24 hours. The boy's family approached police after the kidnappers called his father and asked for ₹30 lakh. The kidnappers began to fire shots when the police intercepted them, following which, police fired back and two of the kidnappers were injured, an official said.

121.title: 2 settlements in Kherson region liberated: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy
121.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that the country's forces have liberated two settlements of Arkhanhelske and Myrolyubivka in Kherson region. During his nightly address, Zelenskyy thanked Ukrainian forces. Earlier in his address, Zelenskyy mentioned that the success of Ukrainian forces is not limited to the recapture of the city of Lyman in Donetsk region.

122.title: 21-yr-old Guj man dies of heart attack while performing garba; incident caught on camera
122.article_body: A video showing a 21-year-old man suddenly collapsing while performing garba in Gujarat's Anand has surfaced online. He was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him dead and said that he died of a heart attack. Last month, a 20-year-old artist died while dancing on stage in Jammu and Kashmir.

123.title: Nitish Kumar calls Akhilesh, enquires about Mulayam Singh's health
123.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar spoke to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav to enquire about the health of Mulayam Singh, who was shifted to the ICU at the Medanta hospital in Gurugram on Sunday. "Mulayam Singh's health is stable…His oxygen levels decreased a little bit but as per doctors, there is no need to worry," said SP leader Rakesh Yadav.

124.title: Prez pays tribute to Mahatma Gandhi, spins charkha at Sabarmati ashram
124.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi at Sabarmati ashram on Monday in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. She also spun the charkha at the ashram, a video of which has surfaced online. Murmu, who is on a two-day tour of Gujarat, will later inaugurate and lay the foundation stone for projects worth ₹1,330 crore in Gandhinagar, according to a government release.

125.title: EPAM Systems asks 100 Indian employees to resign, revokes offer letters: Report
125.article_body: NYSE-listed IT services provider EPAM Systems reportedly asked around 100 Indian employees to resign and has also revoked offer letters of others who were about to join the firm in the next few months. As per a report, HR managers told the affected staff that the company over-hired, misjudged demand forecasts, and couldn't fund onboarding projects in the near future.

126.title: I was really frightened to do 'Adipurush': Prabhas
126.article_body: Prabhas said he was "really frightened" to portray the character of Lord Ram in 'Adipurush'. "With a lot of love, respect and fear we did this film. May Lord Ram bless us," Prabhas added. Kriti Sanon, who plays Janaki in the Om Raut directorial, called the film "a dream experience". She added, "I just hope I don't disappoint you all."

127.title: We lacked belief: Man Utd coach Ten Hag on defeat against Man City
127.article_body: Manchester United coach Erik ten Hag has said they "lacked the belief" and weren't "brave enough" in their game against Manchester City as they lost 3-6 on Sunday. "In the last five games we had a strong belief...it was the other way around [against City]," he stated. United had registered wins in their last four games in the Premier League.

128.title: Flight tracking website shows plane with 'bomb threat' reducing altitude over Delhi-Jaipur
128.article_body: Flightradar24 data shows Mahan Air flight (IRM081) reducing altitude over Delhi-Jaipur airspace before making its way out of the Indian airspace, ANI reported. Delhi Police received inputs about a bomb threat on the plane from Iran to China, ANI said. The plane wasn't allowed to land in Delhi and was reportedly asked to divert to Jaipur but the pilots refused.

129.title: 1 killed, 2 rescued after building collapses during demolition in Gurugram
129.article_body: One labourer was killed after a three-storey old building collapsed during demolition in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar. Two labourers were successfully rescued. The building was being demolished since September 26. Police said that two floors of the building had already been demolished. Fire Officer Lalit Kumar had earlier said that rescue ops were underway.

130.title: Didn’t know if '83' will open Bollywood's doors for me: Harrdy Sandhu
130.article_body: Singer-actor Harrdy Sandhu said he didn't know if '83' would open Bollywood doors for him. Harrdy said the film was God's gift to him as, with it, he fulfilled his wish to become a cricketer. Harrdy will now be seen in 'Code Name: Tiranga' with Parineeti Chopra. "It never felt like we haven't met ever," Harrdy said about Parineeti.

131.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan' earns ₹202.87 crore worldwide on opening weekend
131.article_body: Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan' has earned ₹202.87 crore at the worldwide box office within three days of its release. Trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan on Monday shared that the film earned ₹78.29 crore, ₹60.16 crore and ₹64.42 crore on Friday, Saturday and Sunday, respectively. He also informed that the film collected ₹69.71 crore in Tamil Nadu.

132.title: NCP leader recalls Pawar’s rally after Rahul’s speech in Mysuru amid rains
132.article_body: After Congress' Rahul Gandhi addressed a rally in Mysuru amid heavy rains on Sunday, NCP's Clyde Crasto drew parallels between Rahul's address and NCP chief Sharad Pawar’s rain-drenched speech during bypoll campaign in 2019. Crasto tweeted pictures of both the leaders, saying, "When the rain Gods decide to bless you, there will soon be a storm in the Opposition camp."

133.title: PayU terminates $4.7 billion deal to acquire BillDesk
133.article_body: Prosus on Monday announced that it is terminating the agreement signed by its subsidiary PayU to acquire Indian online payments gateway BillDesk for $4.7 billion. The decision to terminate the deal comes nearly a month after the CCI approved the deal. Prosus said certain conditions precedent were not fulfilled by the long stop date and the agreement has terminated automatically.

134.title: UK drops plan to scrap 45% rate of income tax for highest earners
134.article_body: The UK government has announced it will not go ahead with the plan to scrap 45% rate of income tax for the country's highest earners. The reversal comes 10 days after the measure was first announced. "It's clear that...abolition of...45p tax rate has become a distraction from our overriding mission to tackle...challenges facing our economy," Finance Minister Kwasi Kwarteng said.

135.title: Humbled & honoured: Devgn on winning 2 National Awards for 'Tanhaji...'
135.article_body: Ajay Devgn said he is "humbled and honoured" to have won two National Awards, one as a Producer of Best Film and one as Best Actor, for his film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior'. "This is my third win as Best Actor. I feel elated yet humbled each time this happens," he added. Ajay shared his Best Actor award with Suriya.

136.title: Amitabh Bachchan is an absolutely brilliant performer: Rashmika
136.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said her 'Goodbye' co-star Amitabh Bachchan "is an absolutely brilliant performer". She added, "A gem of a person who always argues with me as a reel papa." Rashmika said she's grateful to have worked with Amitabh Bachchan in 'Goodbye'. "It's been an absolute honour and this will forever be super special," she wrote.

137.title: He never makes you feel like an outsider: Jayam Ravi on Mani Ratnam
137.article_body: Actor Jayam Ravi said Director Mani Ratnam "never makes you feel like an outsider". Ravi, who plays Chola king Rajaraja in Mani's 'Ponniyin Selvan', said he met the "sweetest people" while working on the film. "I've worked with Trisha before, and Vikram is like my brother. Karthi and I have become brothers now. That's the bond we have," he added.

138.title: Honour for weavers: T'gana minister on Gollabhama sarees' UNESCO listing
138.article_body: Telangana minister T Harish Rao has thanked weavers from Siddipet over Gollabhama sarees' UNESCO listing and described it as an "honour" to the skill of the weavers. Rao is the MLA for Siddipet. Gollabhama sarees were mentioned in UNESCO's "Handmade for the 21st Century: Safeguarding Traditional Indian Textile" list along with Himroo weaving and Gongadi sheep wool blankets, among others.

139.title: More than 80 people killed due to Hurricane Ian, rescue efforts underway
139.article_body: More than 80 people have died due to Hurricane Ian. Hundreds of thousands of people in Florida and the Carolinas are left without electricity. The National Guard and the Coast Guard flew helicopters over Florida's barrier islands to rescue people. US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden will visit Puerto Rico on Monday and Florida on Wednesday.

140.title: We restricted them to 106 in 1st game: Rahul on India's bowling in 2nd SA T20I
140.article_body: Defending India's bowling in the second T20I against South Africa, KL Rahul said though there's room for the bowlers to improve, the conditions should also be considered. "Two days back, they got SA bowled out for 106...there was a little bit of dew [today], it's also a very humid place, so it's hard for the bowlers to grip," he explained.

141.title: 3 men walking on railway tracks in MP die after moving train hits them
141.article_body: Three men walking on railway tracks were killed when they were hit by a moving train in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar, police said. The incident took place on Sunday evening. The deceased have been identified as 26-year-old Dharmendra Yadav, 30-year-old Sanju Ghoshi and 28-year-old Rajkumar Yadav, an official said. Police have registered a case.

142.title: IAF inducts 1st batch of made-in-India Light Combat Helicopters
142.article_body: The Indian Air Force on Monday inducted the first batch of made-in-India Light Combat Helicopters (LCH) at the Jodhpur Air Force base in Rajasthan. The ceremony was led by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. Manufactured by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited, the Light Combat Helicopters are capable of destroying enemy air defence and can be deployed in counter-insurgency operations.

143.title: 10-year-old boy rapes 6-year-old girl in animal shed in UP
143.article_body: Police has detained a 10-year-old boy for allegedly raping a six-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun. The girl was playing outside her home when the accused allegedly lured her and took her with him to a cattle shed. Police said that necessary legal action is being taken against the accused after taking him into the custody as per the law.

144.title: Medicines may soon get QR codes to check for their authenticity: Reports
144.article_body: In a bid to prevent the use of counterfeit and substandard medicines, the central government may soon launch a "track and trace" mechanism, under which QR codes will be printed on the primary packaging labels, as per reports. The QR codes will allow consumers to check the authenticity of the drugs while providing them with additional information.

145.title: 'Bomb threat' on China-bound Iranian plane over Indian airspace, IAF jets scrambled: Report
145.article_body: Indian Air Force fighter jets from Punjab and Jodhpur were scrambled to intercept an Iranian passenger aircraft that was moving towards New Delhi's airspace on Monday as security agencies received inputs about the possibility of a bomb on board, ANI reported. The plane was not allowed to land in Delhi and is now moving towards China, ANI added.

146.title: Centre should provide weekly money to needy families as social security: Gehlot
146.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said the Centre should provide money on a weekly basis as social security to all needy people in the country. "Why shouldn't families compulsorily get weekly money like other countries? This will help in running families...only those who need it will get [it]," Gehlot asked. "You go to London, America, social security is everywhere," he stated.

147.title: ISRO's Mars orbiter runs out of fuel 8 years after launch, loses link: Officials
147.article_body: The Mars orbiter launched by the ISRO in 2013 has run out of propellant and its battery has drained beyond the safe limit, PTI reported citing officials. The Mars Orbiter Mission reportedly entered a long eclipse period in April and lost contact with ground station. The ₹450-crore craft, designed to last only for six months, orbited Mars for eight years.

148.title: Telangana CM KCR to enter national politics on Vijayadashami: Reports
148.article_body: According to reports, Telangana CM KCR is expected to enter into national politics on Vijayadashami, which is on October 5. The particulars of the plan are being worked out and the TRS could be renamed. On September 5, He had announced that free electricity would be supplied to farmers across the country if a non-BJP government comes to power.

149.title: PE, VC funding to Indian startups slowed 20% in 2022: Report
149.article_body: The funding coming into Indian startups through private equity (PE) and venture capital (VC) reduced from 949 investments worth $45.4 billion in January-September 2021 to 1,016 investments worth $36 billion in the same period this year, Venture Intelligence data showed. The funding slowed a little over 20% by value in the first nine months of 2022.

150.title: Ghaziabad Police arrest 6 people for vandalising Durga Puja pandal
150.article_body: Ghaziabad Police on Sunday arrested six people for allegedly vandalising a Durga Puja pandal in Sahibabad. According to the complaint, a person claimed that his neighbour objected to the loud music at the pandal, however, even after the music's volume was lowered, the suspects vandalised the pandal and fought with the organisers, a police station in charge said.

151.title: Odisha CM launches month-long 'Jana Sampark Padyatra' from Bhubaneswar
151.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik launched BJD's month-long "Jana Sampark Padyatra" from Bhubaneswar. "The padyatra will be organised across the state starting from ward, panchayat, town and Assembly segment, every leader and worker of the party will go to the people and inform them about the development work across the sectors," said Debi Mishra, Vice President of BJD.

152.title: Margot Robbie, Cara's friends break arm of photographer taking their pics: Report
152.article_body: Actress Margot Robbie and model-actress Cara Delevingne's filmmaker friends were arrested for attacking a photographer aggressively taking their photos in Argentina's Buenos Aires, according to reports. The photographer's arm was reportedly broken after the fight. Robbie nearly fell out of a car because of the photographer, following which their friends intervened, reports added.

153.title: David Miller breaks world record for highest-ever score by a no. 5 batter in T20I cricket
153.article_body: South Africa batter David Miller has broken the world record for registering the highest-ever score by a number five batter in T20I cricket. The 33-year-old slammed an unbeaten 106 off 47 deliveries against India in second T20I to set the record. The previous record was held by Romania's Sivakumar Periyalwar, who had slammed 105*(40) against Turkey on August 29, 2019.

154.title: We need to improve in the T20Is: Babar Azam after 67-run defeat vs Eng
154.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said they need to improve in the shortest format of the game after losing the seventh T20I against England on Sunday. "With 200 runs on the board, if we lose early wickets, it puts pressure on the other batters. This series was vital for us," added Babar. Batting first, England posted 209/3 in the game.

155.title: England finish their first tour to Pakistan in 17 years with 4-3 series win
155.article_body: England finished their first tour to Pakistan in 17 years with a 67-run win in the final T20I on Sunday, claiming the seven-match series 4-3. England won the first, third, sixth and seventh T20I, with 23-year-old batter Harry Brook being named the 'Player of the Series' for scoring a total of 238 runs. Muhammad Rizwan (316 runs) top-scored for Pakistan.

156.title: India reports 3,011 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 36,126
156.article_body: India reported 3,011 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The active cases in the country went down to 36,126 from the earlier 37,444, as per the ministry. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,701. The weekly positivity rate currently stands at 1.31%.

157.title: Mitchell Johnson pushes Yusuf Pathan amid fight during Legends League Cricket match
157.article_body: India Capitals' Mitchell Johnson and Bhilwara Kings' Yusuf Pathan got involved in a fight during their Legends League Cricket match. In a video that went viral on social media, the duo can be seen arguing with each other before Johnson pushes Yusuf away. The umpires can then be seen intervening. Yusuf scored 48(24) in the match.

158.title: Surprised I'm getting this, Surya had bigger impact: Rahul on Player of the Match award
158.article_body: After being named Player of the Match for scoring 57(28) in the second T20I against South Africa, India opener KL Rahul said, "Quite honestly I am surprised, I am getting the award." He added, "Suryakumar Yadav had a bigger impact on the game. He changed the game," Rahul said. Suryakumar scored 61 runs off 22 deliveries.

159.title: 4 kids drown in tank while trying to save each other in Ranga Reddy
159.article_body: Four children, aged between nine and 14, drowned in a tank under Yacharam police station limits in Ranga Reddy on Sunday, police said. The children died one by one as they tried to save each other, a police inspector said. The District Collector has announced a ₹50,000 ex-gratia to each of the deceased's families, the police inspector added.

160.title: Bengaluru ranks 43 among 45 cities in Swachh Survekshan ranking
160.article_body: Bengaluru was ranked 43rd among 45 cities surveyed under the Swachh Survekshan, a steep downfall from the 28th spot in the previous year. While Madhya Pradesh's Indore was ranked first in the list for the sixth consecutive year, Surat and Navi Mumbai stood second and third. Bengaluru was better only than Chennai and Madurai, which were in the bottom two.

161.title: 60 cr people changed habit of open defecation: Prez at Swachh Bharat Diwas event
161.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday said since the launch of ‘Swachh Bharat Mission-Gramin’ in 2014, over 11 crore toilets have been constructed and about 60 crore people have changed their habit of open defecation. She said that ‘Swachh Bharat Mission-Gramin’ is a behaviour-change movement. President Murmu was addressing an event to celebrate Swachh Bharat Diwas in New Delhi.

162.title: 60-year-old farmer dies of heart attack at protest site in Punjab
162.article_body: A 60-year-old farmer died of a heart attack at a protest site in Punjab's Gumjal village. The deceased was an activist of BKU (Rajewal), which is holding a protest over compensation for damaged cotton crop and availability of canal water. "We'll not cremate...body till...government doesn't announce ₹1 crore compensation...government job and debt waiver for...shaheed kisaan," a farm leader said.

163.title: Pune Municipal Corporation issues work order for e-bike rental service
163.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) issued a work order to a private firm to introduce e-bikes on rent and set up 250 charging stations across the city in the next two months. "The proposal to implement the e-bike rental project will be done in a phase-wise manner," said Shrinivas Kandul, head of the electrical department, PMC.

164.title: Muslim, Hindu inmates hold Navratri fast for communal harmony in UP
164.article_body: As many as 218 Muslim inmates and 1,104 Hindu inmates are observing the Navratri fast at a jail in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar for communal harmony, a jail superintendent said. The jail superintendent added that the prison authorities have made special arrangements for fruits, milk and 'kuttu' flour. The Muslim inmates are apparently fasting in solidarity with the Hindu inmates.

165.title: Man injured after high-tension wire explodes in his hand at Pune station
165.article_body: A man received 80 per cent burn injuries after he grabbed a high-tension wire while walking on the roof of a train in Pune. A video of the incident has gone viral. The man received a shock as soon as he touched the wire above him and fell off the roof of the train. He was admitted to a hospital.

166.title: 3-storey building collapses while demolition in Gurugram, 3 labourers trapped
166.article_body: A three-storey building that was being demolished since September 26, collapsed in Gurugram's Udyog Vihar. Three labourers are reported to be trapped under the collapsed building. Fire Officer Lalit Kumar said that the rescue operations are currently underway and that one labourer has been rescued. Two floors of the building had already been demolished, police said.

167.title: Man poses as UP policeman, extorts cash from locals in Firozabad; held
167.article_body: The Firozabad Police have arrested a man for posing as a policeman and extorting money from locals. According to reports, the accused, Mukesh Yadav, was arrested while he was accepting money from vehicles in the city. The police recovered a fake Aadhaar card, a fake ID card of Police Inspector, a photo in police uniform and other items from him.

168.title: Pegasus used to attack 3 activists in Mexico between 2019-21: Report
168.article_body: Phones of at least two journalists and a human rights activist in Mexico were infected with Pegasus spyware between 2019 and 2021, researchers at Citizen Lab said in a report. The findings noted that the three victims had documented alleged human rights abuses by Mexico's armed forces. Pegasus can be used to remotely break into phones and access information.

169.title: Alfaaz is still serious in ICU, please pray for him: Honey Singh
169.article_body: Yo Yo Honey Singh on Monday took to Instagram to post that Punjabi singer Alfaaz, who was hit by a tempo truck on Saturday night, is still serious in the ICU and requested his fans to pray for him. Alfaaz was admitted to a private hospital in Mohali with multiple injuries. Police on Sunday arrested the vehicle driver, Vicky.

170.title: Pak bowling coach Tait says 'When we lose badly, they send me to presser'; video viral
170.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Pakistan bowling coach Shaun Tait's reaction on being sent to the press conference following Pakistan's defeat in sixth T20I against England. "So when we lose badly...they send me [to press conference]," Tait said at start of the press conference. England won the sixth T20I by eight wickets and the seventh T20I by 67 runs.

171.title: iPhone detects impact, alerts police after car crashes into tree killing 6 people in US
171.article_body: An iPhone 14 automatically alerted emergency responders after a car crashed into a tree in US. While the cause of crash is yet to be determined, police said the iPhone detected the impact and called responders when the phone's owner didn't respond. All six occupants of the car, five men and a woman aged between 21 and 24, were killed.

172.title: Sanctioned Russian billionaire's 168-ft superyacht put on sale for £26 million
172.article_body: A 168-foot superyacht linked to sanctioned Russian billionaire Igor Kesaev has been put on sale for £26 million. The MySky superyacht, whose interiors have been designed by Dutch architect Erick van Egeraat, comes with a gym, helicopter landing deck and five cabins. The EU and UK sanctioned Kesaev in April in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

173.title: I had to keep the tempo set by Rohit, Rahul: Suryakumar on 61(22)
173.article_body: India's Suryakumar Yadav, who scored 61(22) against South Africa on Sunday, said he just went in to bat and enjoyed himself. "We were batting first, so...I had to keep the tempo that was set by Rahul and Rohit," he added. Notably, Suryakumar has now become the fastest batter to reach 1,000 T20I runs in terms of balls faced (573).

174.title: 3,200 MT wheat meant for public distribution decays in Haryana
174.article_body: Nearly 3,200 metric tonnes of wheat, which was meant for public distribution, has decayed due to negligence in Haryana's Kaithal. The decayed wheat is estimated to be worth ₹ 6.5 crore, officials said. State Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs Department Director Mukul Kumar said that the matter is being investigated and action will be taken.

175.title: No G-23 camp now, all leaders united to fight against BJP, RSS: Cong's Kharge
175.article_body: Congress Presidential polls candidate Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday said that the dissenting "G-23 camp" no longer exists.
