351.article_body: Two men allegedly killed a six-year-old as "human sacrifice" by slitting his throat in Delhi's Lodhi Colony, police said. The incident took place at the under-construction Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) headquarters. The accused stated that he saw 'Bhole Baba', who wanted him to slit the child's throat, said DCP (south) Chandan Chowdhary.

352.title: Conspiracy by enemies: Taliban as 35 die in Kabul suicide blast
352.article_body: Taliban government's Foreign Affairs Ministry has stated that the attacks carried out on mosques, educational centres and other public places are "a conspiracy by the enemies of the Afghan people". This comes as the death toll in the suicide blast at an education centre in Kabul rose to at least 35, according to United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA).

353.title: Someone told Kareena I'll only do TV now when I did 'Sacred...': Saif
353.article_body: Saif Ali Khan revealed someone had told his wife Kareena Kapoor that Saif will only do TV after he had accepted to be a part of 'Sacred Games'. "That's when 'Sacred Games' wasn't even a TV show, it was for an OTT platform," he added. "You can stay relevant as a person if you keep your thoughts new...updated," Saif stated.

354.title: 5 masked men enter Maharashtra bank with swords, video surfaces
354.article_body: Five masked men entered a bank with swords in Maharashtra's Nanded. A video of the incident was shared by News18 Lokmat. Locals and bank employees managed to catch one man, reports said. The incident took place in the Sindhi area of the Umri district. The video was retweeted by several people.

355.title: 14-year-old boy tied to pole and beaten over suspicion of theft in Karnataka
355.article_body: A 14-year-old Dalit boy was tied to a pole and thrashed by locals over suspicion of stealing earrings in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur. "They asked us which caste we belong to and said that people of our caste shouldn't live in their village and that we should all be killed," said the boy's mother, who was also attacked. Three people were arrested.

356.title: In high-scoring Aus series, Axar was at his economical best: Ashwin
356.article_body: Praising Axar Patel, Ravichandran Ashwin said the 28-year-old has impressed with his orthodox left-arm spin bowling in a world where the focus is on mystery spin, googly and wrist spin. "In a high-scoring series [vs Australia], he was at his economical best...Pure value for putting the ball where he wants to and varying his pace, line and length," added Ashwin.

357.title: Locals stage protest in Delhi's Sunder Nagri after 25-yr-old murdered
357.article_body: After the murder of a 25-year-old man in Delhi's Sunder Nagri area, angry locals staged a protest demanding a speedy probe into the matter. A police force has been deployed in the area as a precautionary measure to avoid any untoward situation. According to Delhi Police, the motive behind the murder seems to be an old enmity.

358.title: Moderna refused China's request to provide vaccine tech: Report
358.article_body: Moderna had refused to provide China with the intellectual property behind the development of mRNA vaccine, citing commercial and safety concerns, according to the Financial Times. The report said that Moderna had "given up" on efforts to access the Chinese market because of the country's demand to hand over the technology as a prerequisite for selling it in the country.

359.title: TV actress Anaya Soni suffers kidney failure, says 'Condition is serious'
359.article_body: TV actress Anaya Soni, who has featured in shows like 'Crime Patrol', took to Instagram to reveal she has suffered kidney failure. She said she will get hospitalised on Monday, adding, "My creatinine have come to 15.76 and hemoglobin is 6.7. Condition is serious." She stated, "[I'll] soon have to go with my kidney transplant...Will apply for kidney post dialysis."

360.title: Sunil Mittal praises Mukesh Ambani, says 'We had to run very fast to catch up on 4G'
360.article_body: Bharti Airtel's Sunil Mittal has praised rival company Reliance Jio's efforts to push 4G technology in India. "I would like to remind Mukesh (Ambani) when he gave a lot of pace to 4G and we had run very fast to catch up with it," he acknowledged. He further said the country's pulse didn't stop for a minute when COVID-19 hit.

361.title: Rare Hermès 'Himalaya' bag sells for ₹2.8 crore at auction; pics surface
361.article_body: A rare Hermès Himalaya Retourné Kelly 25 bag was sold for €352,800 (more than ₹2.8 crore) at a Sotheby's auction in Paris. The handbag, in 'mother-of-pearl white' colour, is reminiscent of a snowy mountain landscape. It is "one of the hardest bags to obtain" in a Hermès boutique, a Sotheby's executive said.

362.title: Apple adds iPhone 6 to its 'vintage' products list
362.article_body: Apple has added iPhone 6 to its list of vintage products as it has been over five years since it was last offered for sale. The iPhone 6 Plus was added to the list earlier this year. Apple has moved the 2012 iPod nano 7 and the fifth-generation iPod touch from the vintage list to the obsolete list.

363.title: 31-yr-old man kills wife at Hyderabad lodge over suspicion of affair
363.article_body: A 31-year-old security guard allegedly strangulated his 21-year-old wife to death at a lodge on Saturday over suspicion of an affair with his brother in Hyderabad’s Afzalgunj. The man checked into the lodge with the victim and allegedly killed her, police said. Later, he walked into the police station and surrendered.

364.title: Sidhu Moosewala murder accused gangster Tinu escapes police custody: Reports
364.article_body:
Gangster Deepak Tinu, an accused in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case, escaped police custody in Punjab's Mansa district on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday, according to reports. 
"We are working on it, police parties are on the job and we will catch him soon," reports quoted police as saying. Tinu is a close aide of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi.

365.title: Will re-evaluate safety: Indonesia minister as 174 die in football match stampede
365.article_body: Indonesia's Youth and Sports Minister Zainudin Amali said on Sunday that authorities will re-evaluate safety at football matches as the death toll from a stampede and riot at a match in East Java rose to 174. "This is a regrettable incident that injures our football at a time when supporters can watch football matches from the stadium," he added.

366.title: Meghalaya HC grants bail to BJP leader accused of running sex racket
366.article_body: The Meghalaya High Court granted conditional bail to BJP state Vice President Bernard N Marak, who is accused of running a sex racket at his farmhouse. The court directed Marak not to abscond or tamper with evidence and to cooperate in the investigation. He was also asked to furnish a personal bond of ₹50,000.

367.title: Google Translate discontinued in mainland China due to 'low usage'
367.article_body: Google has discontinued Google Translate in mainland China "due to low usage". Earlier, reports said Google had disabled access to the service in parts of China, redirecting visitors to the Hong Kong domain. The reports added that it had swapped the Translate interface at translate.google.cn with a generic Google Search page.

368.title: 3-day-old body of man found in bathroom of a PG in Bengaluru
368.article_body: The body of a 24-year-old man was found in a bathroom of a paying guest (PG) facility in Bengaluru, nearly three days after he died, the police said. The deceased, identified as HS Anil Kumar, used to work as a writer in a private firm and lived in a PG at Govindaraja Nagar. Kumar's body was found by housekeeping staff.

369.title: Free & quality education should be arranged for every child: Sisodia
369.article_body: Deputy CM of Delhi Manish Sisodia said arrangements for free and quality education should be made for every child in the country. "Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and I have a dream that every child of Delhi should get a wonderful school to study, where they should be given world-class education free of cost," Sisodia added.

370.title: NASA pushes Artemis I launch to Nov after Hurricane Ian delays launch
370.article_body: NASA is now planning to launch the Artemis l mission between November 12-27. The announcement comes after Hurricane Ian scrubbed its plans to launch the mission on September 27. The storm forced NASA to roll Artemis l off the launch pad at Florida's Kennedy Space Center. The facility was hit by the hurricane in which Artemis l suffered no damage.

371.title: UN chief asks people to 'embrace peace' on int'l non-violence day
371.article_body: UN Secretary-General António Guterres on the occasion of International Day of Non-Violence on Sunday said that on this day, "we celebrate Mahatma Gandhi's birthday and values of peace, respect and the essential dignity shared by everyone." He added that by embracing these values and working across cultures and borders, "we can defeat today's challenges...to build a better future".

372.title: Suryakumar's purple patch can't be described in words: Ashwin
372.article_body: Speaking on his YouTube channel, spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said Suryakumar Yadav's purple patch can't be described in words. "We have Maxwell, Neesham, Pollard, Tim David, Hardik and Karthik on the world's best finishers list...But Suryakumar has the best strike rate amongst them," added Ashwin. Notably, Suryakumar has already recorded the most T20I runs among Indians in 2022 (732 runs).

373.title: Concerns about functioning of SC collegium can’t be brushed aside: Ex-CJI
373.article_body: Ex-CJI NV Ramana said concerns raised in different quarters, including by the government, relating to functioning of the Supreme Court collegium system cannot be brushed aside. The Supreme Court passed a series of judgments declaring the collegium system necessary to ensure independence of the judiciary but judiciary is merely one of the many players involved in the process, he added.

374.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann breaks into bhangra at garba event in Gujarat, video goes viral
374.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister and AAP leader Bhagwant Mann took part in a garba event in Rajkot, Gujarat on Saturday. In a video that has gone viral on social media, Mann is seen breaking into bhangra after a few steps of garba on public request. Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha also participated in a garba event in Vadodara.

375.title: 66 e-scooters, 132 batteries stolen from warehouse in Gurugram
375.article_body: A total of 66 e-scooters, 132 batteries and several chargers were stolen from a warehouse of a logistics company in Gurugram's Sector 52, police officials said. The suspects tried to take away more vehicles as 18 of them were either found to be damaged or with their locks broken, the police added. An FIR has been registered against unidentified suspects.

376.title: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh, who criticised his own government, resigns
376.article_body: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh, who had recently criticised his own government's policies, has resigned. Singh had said that there is no wing of the state Agricultural Department that does not commit acts of theft.  He had also called himself a "sardar of thieves". Later, he had said that he stood by his words and will not amend his statement.

377.title: Huge avalanche hits Nepal's Manaslu Base Camp; video surfaces
377.article_body: A video of a huge avalanche hitting the Manaslu Base Camp in Nepal on Sunday has surfaced online. This is the second avalanche to take place in Nepal since the one that occurred on September 26 left two persons dead. A person who was trying to climb Mount Manaslu said that there were no human casualties, reported ANI.

378.title: Richa Chadha & Ali Fazal share pics from their phool haldi, mehendi events
378.article_body: Actors Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal on Sunday took to their respective Instagram handles to share photos from their mehendi, phool haldi and sangeet ceremonies held at Delhi's Gymkhana Club on Friday. They will reportedly get married in the first week of October and later host their reception at a contemporary furniture store inside a 176-year-old mill in Mumbai.

379.title: Vote for Kharge if satisfied with Congress' working: Tharoor
379.article_body: Ahead of Congress Presidential poll, party leader Shashi Tharoor said this isn't a battle. "I'm saying that if you're satisfied with the party's working, vote for [Mallikarjun] Kharge sahab. If you want a change, I'm there but there's no ideological problem," Tharoor added. Tharoor and party veteran Mallikarjun Kharge are contesting the election, scheduled on October 17.

380.title: Deaths due to stampede, riot after football match in Indonesia rise to 174
380.article_body: The death toll due to stampede and riot after a football match in Indonesia's East Java has risen to 174, authorities said on Sunday. Police said that when supporters of the losing home team invaded the pitch to express their frustration, officers fired tear gas in an attempt to control the situation, triggering a stampede and cases of suffocation.

381.title: Gehlot backs Mallikarjun Kharge in Congress chief poll, says Tharoor from 'elite class'
381.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that Mallikarjun Kharge has the experience to strengthen the Congress and would emerge as a clear winner in the party presidential poll, while Shashi Tharoor belongs to the "elite class". "Kharge has a clean heart, he comes from the Dalit community...Tharoor is a class apart, he is from elite class," Gehlot said.

382.title: Traffic restrictions announced in parts of Mumbai for Durga idol immersions
382.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police issued traffic restrictions and directions that will be enforced across the city on October 5 and 6 for Durga idol immersions. As per the advisory, more than 20 key roads in the city, especially in South Mumbai and Eastern Suburbs, will be closed for normal vehicular movement and only vehicles carrying idols will be allowed.

383.title: Chinese billionaire settles allegation of raping 21-yr-old hours before trial in US
383.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's billionaire Founder Richard Liu agreed to settle a rape lawsuit less than 48 hours before a trial was set to begin in US. A former college student had accused Liu of raping her after a dinner with wealthy Chinese executives in 2018. She was 21 at the time and had attended the dinner as a volunteer.

384.title: There's no like-for-like replacement for Bumrah in world, leave alone India: Watson
384.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said Jasprit Bumrah's absence will make it "all the more difficult" for India to win the 2022 T20 WC. "There's no like-for-like replacement for Bumrah in the world, leave alone India," stated Watson. Meanwhile, India coach Rahul Dravid has said they're waiting for the "official confirmation" on Bumrah being completely ruled out of the tournament.

385.title: Kerala LoP Satheesan extends support to Kharge in party polls
385.article_body: Kerala Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan extended his support to Mallikarjun Kharge for the Congress’ Presidential polls instead of Shashi Tharoor. "I have decided to support Mallikarjun Kharge. He is a very senior politician and a senior congressman...He belongs to the Dalit community. I am very happy that a Dalit leader will be elected President of the AICC," said Satheesan.

386.title: Maha govt order asks officials to say Vande Mataram instead of hello on calls from today
386.article_body: Maharashtra government on Saturday issued Government Resolution, making it mandatory for employees working in government and government-funded institutions to say ‘Vande Mataram’ instead of ‘hello’ while receiving phone calls from government officials and citizens. The campaign will be launched in Maharashtra on Sunday. Officials have also been asked to create awareness to use ‘Vande Mataram’.

387.title: Will repatriate illegal money from Swiss banks: Kejriwal in Gujarat
387.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal stated that those involved in "corruption" under the BJP government in Gujarat have parked their money in "Swiss banks" and his party will bring it back if it is voted to power in the state. The AAP national convenor has also promised the construction of 20,000 mohalla clinics on the lines of Delhi, across Gujarat.

388.title: UP CM pays floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi, asks people to wear khadi
388.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath paid floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi in Lucknow on the occasion of Mahatma's 153rd birth anniversary. "Gandhi ji had made an invaluable contribution to the independence of the country by uniting the people in the thread of unity...People must wear at least one khadi product," said the CM.

389.title: Unkind commentary never ends: Mahira on criticism for attending awards amid Pak floods
389.article_body: Actress Mahira Khan responded to a Twitter user after the latter criticised her for attending an award show in Canada amid Pakistan's floods and remarked that she would later donate her dresses. Mahira tweeted, "It's never ok for us...If it makes you happy, I can take some pictures while at it...But then it'll be...showing off doing charity...Unkind commentary never ends."

390.title: Bomb threat on IndiGo flight at Mumbai airport turns out to be a hoax
390.article_body: A threat email warning of a bomb on an IndiGo flight was received at Mumbai airport on Saturday, the Mumbai Police said. However, during the inspection of the flight, nothing was found in it, the Mumbai Police informed on Sunday. The IndiGo flight, which was scheduled to go to Ahmedabad from Mumbai, was delayed after the bomb threat.

391.title: Pained by Suzlon Founder's demise, he was a pioneering business leader: PM Modi
391.article_body: PM Narendra Modi condoled the demise of Suzlon Founder Tulsi Tanti who passed away at the age of 64 after suffering a cardiac arrest on Saturday. "Tanti was a pioneering business leader who contributed to India's economic progress and strengthened our nation's efforts to further sustainable development. Pained by his untimely demise," PM Modi wrote on Twitter.

392.title: Woman constable injured after falling off T'gana CM's convoy, video surfaces
392.article_body: A female constable fell out of a car that was moving in Telangana Chief Minister KCR's convoy. She sustained minor injuries, reports said. A video of incident was shared online. The incident took place during KCR's latest visit to Warangal. In the video, the constable can be seen falling off the car and then getting up and running after it.

393.title: PM Modi offers condolences to US Prez as 51 die due to Hurricane Ian
393.article_body: PM Narendra Modi offered his "sincere condolences and heartfelt sympathies" to United States President Joe Biden as the death toll due to Hurricane Ian rose to 51 in the country. Of the total deaths, 47 deaths were reported from Florida. "Our thoughts are with the people of the United States in these difficult times, " PM Modi added.

394.title: 51 killed in US due to Hurricane Ian, Biden to visit Florida on Wednesday
394.article_body: At least 51 people, 47 in Florida and four in North Carolina, have died due to Hurricane Ian. The Category 4 hurricane, one of the strongest to hit US, flooded roadways and damaged bridges. Nearly one million homes and businesses were without electricity on Saturday. US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden will travel to Florida on Wednesday.

395.title: PM Modi requested both Zelenskyy & Putin for ceasefire during evacuation: EAM
395.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar praised PM Modi for his leadership and stated that the PM had requested a ceasefire during the evacuation process from Ukrainian President Zelenskyy and Russian President Vladimir Putin. "PM used to hold back-to-back rallies in UP...and in the evening he used to take updates on the rescue operation," said Jaishankar.

396.title: Mourinho watches Roma's game from team bus after being banned in last game
396.article_body: Roma coach Jose Mourinho shared pictures of him watching his side's game against Inter Milan from their team bus parked outside the stadium. Notably, Mourinho was banned from being present during the game after he stormed onto the pitch and received a red card in their 0-1 defeat against Atalanta last month. Roma beat Inter Milan 2-1.

397.title: Aus criticises Optus for data leak that affected 40% population
397.article_body: The Australian government has criticised its second-biggest telecom firm, Optus, for a cybersecurity breach that affected 10 million accounts, almost 40% of the nation's population. "We should not be in the position we're in, but Optus has put us here," Home Minister Clare O'Neil told a news conference. An unidentified person said they released personal information of 10,000 Optus customers.

398.title: Flooding due to heavy rains leaves 8 dead in Venezuela; 3 missing
398.article_body: At least eight people died and three others are missing after heavy rainfall caused flooding in Venezuela, authorities said. The deceased were among a group of 10 people who were holding a gathering in Tachira and were swept away from an improvised camp, authorities added. Parts of Venezuela have been witnessing heavy rainfall for at least a week.

399.title: I'm not sure an average person can tell you what metaverse is: Apple CEO
399.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook in a recent interview said, "I'm...not sure the average person can tell you what the metaverse is." At the same time, he noted that virtual reality is "something you can really immerse yourself in". Cook added, "[It] can be used in a good way...But I don't think you want to live your whole life that way."

400.title: 25-yr-old stabbed '60 times' by 3 men as bystanders watch in Delhi; act caught on camera
400.article_body: A 25-year-old man identified as Manish died after he was allegedly stabbed 60 times by three men in Delhi's Sunder Nagri. A video of the incident showed the bystanders watching as the accused attacked Manish. Police said the motive of the murder seemed to be an old enmity and arrested three main suspects named Aalam, Bilal and Faizan.
